Young Arch Mage Kazin tracks the source of a plague in Book II of The Dragon Mage Trilogy
THUNDER BAY, Ontario , Oct. 15, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- After risking their lives to overcome numerous obstacles in Book I of The Dragon Mage Trilogy, the human mage Kazin and his unusual entourage of unique companions finally defeated the prophesied darkness as each of them contributed their individual developing abilities and cunning. However, a different darkness is sweeping down toward the Tower of Sorcery, leaving people and livestock dead or dying. And Kazin, together with a new cast of interesting characters, will go on a quest to find and neutralize the source of the plague before it's too late. Many dangers and challenges await them in author Carey Scheppner's Cloak & Dagger: Book II of The Dragon Mage Trilogy .
A mysterious disease is affecting the mages in the Tower of Sorcery. Try as they might, the clerics in the Tower of Hope are unable to heal the disease. Tracking the source of the plague into the mountains, Kazin encounters a new group of unlikely adventurers who assist him on his quest. The sudden inexplicable appearance of elementals in the mortal realm complicates matters, and threatens worldwide cataclysmic devastation should all four elementals be summoned simultaneously.
Kazin's dangerous, mystical adventures won't stop in this second book. His final leg of adventures continue in the last installment of this trilogy, where he must stop whoever's erasing parts of history before the future gets erased altogether.
This book is available online and can be purchased at www.amazon.com and www.barnesandnoble.com .
About the Author
Carey Scheppner is a first-generation Canadian who grew up in a remote Ontario community. He was an avid reader of novels since he could read, and his favourite of these was fantasy novels. After reading a number of predictable novels, he decided to embark on writing his own fantasy novels. He wanted to ensure plenty of action and interesting characters, leaving readers thrilled with the unlimited possibilities of a fantasy world. He enjoys the country lifestyle and enjoys fishing and hunting, a means of leaving the civilized world behind, which leads to an unleashing of the imagination and the creation of strange new worlds.
Cloak & Dagger: Book II of The Dragon Mage Trilogy by Carey Scheppner
